14namespace v8 {
15namespace internal {
16
17bool ExperimentalRegExp::CanBeHandled(RegExpTree* tree, Handle<String> pattern,
18 RegExpFlags flags, int capture_count) {
19 DCHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine ||
20 v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine_on_excessive_backtracks);
21 bool can_be_handled =
22 ExperimentalRegExpCompiler::CanBeHandled(tree, flags, capture_count);
23 if (!can_be_handled && v8_flags.trace_experimental_regexp_engine) {
24 StdoutStream{} << "Pattern not supported by experimental engine: "
25 << pattern << std::endl;
26 }
27 return can_be_handled;
28}
29
30void ExperimentalRegExp::Initialize(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSRegExp> re,
31 Handle<String> source, RegExpFlags flags,
32 int capture_count) {
33 DCHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine);
34 if (v8_flags.trace_experimental_regexp_engine) {
35 StdoutStream{} << "Initializing experimental regexp " << *source
36 << std::endl;
37 }
38
39 isolate->factory()->SetRegExpExperimentalData(
40 re, source, JSRegExp::AsJSRegExpFlags(flags), capture_count);
41}
42
43bool ExperimentalRegExp::IsCompiled(Handle<JSRegExp> re, Isolate* isolate) {
44 DCHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine);
45 DCHECK_EQ(re->type_tag(), JSRegExp::EXPERIMENTAL);
46#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
47 if (v8_flags.verify_heap) re->JSRegExpVerify(isolate);
48#endif
49
50 static constexpr bool kIsLatin1 = true;
51 return re->bytecode(kIsLatin1) != Smi::FromInt(JSRegExp::kUninitializedValue);
52}
53
54template <class T>
55Handle<ByteArray> VectorToByteArray(Isolate* isolate, base::Vector<T> data) {
56 static_assert(std::is_trivial<T>::value);
57
58 int byte_length = sizeof(T) * data.length();
59 Handle<ByteArray> byte_array = isolate->factory()->NewByteArray(byte_length);
60 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
61 MemCopy(byte_array->begin(), data.begin(), byte_length);
62 return byte_array;
63}
64
65namespace {
66
67struct CompilationResult {
68 Handle<ByteArray> bytecode;
69 Handle<FixedArray> capture_name_map;
70};
71
72// Compiles source pattern, but doesn't change the regexp object.
73base::Optional<CompilationResult> CompileImpl(Isolate* isolate,
74 Handle<JSRegExp> regexp) {
75 Zone zone(isolate->allocator(), ZONE_NAME);
76
77 Handle<String> source(regexp->source(), isolate);
78
79 // Parse and compile the regexp source.
80 RegExpCompileData parse_result;
81 DCHECK(!isolate->has_exception());
82
83 RegExpFlags flags = JSRegExp::AsRegExpFlags(regexp->flags());
84 bool parse_success = RegExpParser::ParseRegExpFromHeapString(
85 isolate, &zone, source, flags, &parse_result);
86 if (!parse_success) {
87 // The pattern was already parsed successfully during initialization, so
88 // the only way parsing can fail now is because of stack overflow.
89 DCHECK_EQ(parse_result.error, RegExpError::kStackOverflow);
90 USE(RegExp::ThrowRegExpException(isolate, regexp, flags, source,
91 parse_result.error));
92 return base::nullopt;
93 }
94
95 ZoneList<RegExpInstruction> bytecode = ExperimentalRegExpCompiler::Compile(
96 parse_result.tree, JSRegExp::AsRegExpFlags(regexp->flags()), &zone);
97
98 CompilationResult result;
99 result.bytecode = VectorToByteArray(isolate, bytecode.ToVector());
100 result.capture_name_map =
101 RegExp::CreateCaptureNameMap(isolate, parse_result.named_captures);
102 return result;
103}
104
105} // namespace
106
107bool ExperimentalRegExp::Compile(Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSRegExp> re) {
108 DCHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine);
109 DCHECK_EQ(re->type_tag(), JSRegExp::EXPERIMENTAL);
110#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
111 if (v8_flags.verify_heap) re->JSRegExpVerify(isolate);
112#endif
113
114 Handle<String> source(re->source(), isolate);
115 if (v8_flags.trace_experimental_regexp_engine) {
116 StdoutStream{} << "Compiling experimental regexp " << *source << std::endl;
117 }
118
119 base::Optional<CompilationResult> compilation_result =
120 CompileImpl(isolate, re);
121 if (!compilation_result.has_value()) {
122 DCHECK(isolate->has_exception());
123 return false;
124 }
125
126 re->set_bytecode_and_trampoline(isolate, compilation_result->bytecode);
127 re->set_capture_name_map(compilation_result->capture_name_map);
128
129 return true;
130}
131
132base::Vector<RegExpInstruction> AsInstructionSequence(
133 Tagged<ByteArray> raw_bytes) {
134 RegExpInstruction* inst_begin =
135 reinterpret_cast<RegExpInstruction*>(raw_bytes->begin());
136 int inst_num = raw_bytes->length() / sizeof(RegExpInstruction);
137 DCHECK_EQ(sizeof(RegExpInstruction) * inst_num, raw_bytes->length());
138 return base::Vector<RegExpInstruction>(inst_begin, inst_num);
139}
140
141namespace {
142
143int32_t ExecRawImpl(Isolate* isolate, RegExp::CallOrigin call_origin,
144 Tagged<ByteArray> bytecode, Tagged<String> subject,
145 int capture_count, int32_t* output_registers,
146 int32_t output_register_count, int32_t subject_index) {
147 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
148 // TODO(cbruni): remove once gcmole is fixed.
149 DisableGCMole no_gc_mole;
150
151 int register_count_per_match =
152 JSRegExp::RegistersForCaptureCount(capture_count);
153
154 int32_t result;
155 DCHECK(subject->IsFlat());
156 Zone zone(isolate->allocator(), ZONE_NAME);
157 result = ExperimentalRegExpInterpreter::FindMatches(
158 isolate, call_origin, bytecode, register_count_per_match, subject,
159 subject_index, output_registers, output_register_count, &zone);
160 return result;
161}
162
163} // namespace
164
165// Returns the number of matches.
166int32_t ExperimentalRegExp::ExecRaw(
167 Isolate* isolate, RegExp::CallOrigin call_origin, Tagged<JSRegExp> regexp,
168 Tagged<String> subject, int32_t* output_registers,
169 int32_t output_register_count, int32_t subject_index) {
170 CHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine);
171 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
172
173 if (v8_flags.trace_experimental_regexp_engine) {
174 StdoutStream{} << "Executing experimental regexp " << regexp->source()
175 << std::endl;
176 }
177
178 static constexpr bool kIsLatin1 = true;
179 Tagged<ByteArray> bytecode = ByteArray::cast(regexp->bytecode(kIsLatin1));
180
181 return ExecRawImpl(isolate, call_origin, bytecode, subject,
182 regexp->capture_count(), output_registers,
183 output_register_count, subject_index);
184}
185
186int32_t ExperimentalRegExp::MatchForCallFromJs(
187 Address subject, int32_t start_position, Address input_start,
188 Address input_end, int* output_registers, int32_t output_register_count,
189 RegExp::CallOrigin call_origin, Isolate* isolate, Address regexp) {
190 DCHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine);
191 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(isolate);
192 DCHECK_NOT_NULL(output_registers);
193 DCHECK(call_origin == RegExp::CallOrigin::kFromJs);
194
195 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
196 DisallowJavascriptExecution no_js(isolate);
197 DisallowHandleAllocation no_handles;
198 DisallowHandleDereference no_deref;
199
200 Tagged<String> subject_string = String::cast(Tagged<Object>(subject));
201
202 Tagged<JSRegExp> regexp_obj = JSRegExp::cast(Tagged<Object>(regexp));
203
204 return ExecRaw(isolate, RegExp::kFromJs, regexp_obj, subject_string,
205 output_registers, output_register_count, start_position);
206}
207
208MaybeHandle<Object> ExperimentalRegExp::Exec(
209 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSRegExp> regexp, Handle<String> subject,
210 int subject_index, Handle<RegExpMatchInfo> last_match_info,
211 RegExp::ExecQuirks exec_quirks) {
212 DCHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine);
213 DCHECK_EQ(regexp->type_tag(), JSRegExp::EXPERIMENTAL);
214#ifdef VERIFY_HEAP
215 if (v8_flags.verify_heap) regexp->JSRegExpVerify(isolate);
216#endif
217
218 if (!IsCompiled(regexp, isolate) && !Compile(isolate, regexp)) {
219 DCHECK(isolate->has_exception());
220 return MaybeHandle<Object>();
221 }
222
223 DCHECK(IsCompiled(regexp, isolate));
224
225 subject = String::Flatten(isolate, subject);
226
227 int capture_count = regexp->capture_count();
228 int output_register_count = JSRegExp::RegistersForCaptureCount(capture_count);
229
230 int32_t* output_registers;
231 std::unique_ptr<int32_t[]> output_registers_release;
232 if (output_register_count <= Isolate::kJSRegexpStaticOffsetsVectorSize) {
233 output_registers = isolate->jsregexp_static_offsets_vector();
234 } else {
235 output_registers = NewArray<int32_t>(output_register_count);
236 output_registers_release.reset(output_registers);
237 }
238
239 do {
240 int num_matches =
241 ExecRaw(isolate, RegExp::kFromRuntime, *regexp, *subject,
242 output_registers, output_register_count, subject_index);
243
244 if (num_matches > 0) {
245 DCHECK_EQ(num_matches, 1);
246 if (exec_quirks == RegExp::ExecQuirks::kTreatMatchAtEndAsFailure) {
247 if (output_registers[0] >= subject->length()) {
248 return isolate->factory()->null_value();
249 }
250 }
251 return RegExp::SetLastMatchInfo(isolate, last_match_info, subject,
252 capture_count, output_registers);
253 } else if (num_matches == 0) {
254 return isolate->factory()->null_value();
255 } else {
256 DCHECK_LT(num_matches, 0);
257 if (num_matches == RegExp::kInternalRegExpRetry) {
258 // Re-run execution.
259 continue;
260 }
261 DCHECK(isolate->has_exception());
262 return MaybeHandle<Object>();
263 }
264 } while (true);
265 UNREACHABLE();
266}
267
268int32_t ExperimentalRegExp::OneshotExecRaw(Isolate* isolate,
269 Handle<JSRegExp> regexp,
270 Handle<String> subject,
271 int32_t* output_registers,
272 int32_t output_register_count,
273 int32_t subject_index) {
274 CHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine_on_excessive_backtracks);
275
276 if (v8_flags.trace_experimental_regexp_engine) {
277 StdoutStream{} << "Experimental execution (oneshot) of regexp "
278 << regexp->source() << std::endl;
279 }
280
281 base::Optional<CompilationResult> compilation_result =
282 CompileImpl(isolate, regexp);
283 if (!compilation_result.has_value()) return RegExp::kInternalRegExpException;
284
285 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
286 return ExecRawImpl(isolate, RegExp::kFromRuntime,
287 *compilation_result->bytecode, *subject,
288 regexp->capture_count(), output_registers,
289 output_register_count, subject_index);
290}
291
292MaybeHandle<Object> ExperimentalRegExp::OneshotExec(
293 Isolate* isolate, Handle<JSRegExp> regexp, Handle<String> subject,
294 int subject_index, Handle<RegExpMatchInfo> last_match_info,
295 RegExp::ExecQuirks exec_quirks) {
296 DCHECK(v8_flags.enable_experimental_regexp_engine_on_excessive_backtracks);
297 DCHECK_NE(regexp->type_tag(), JSRegExp::NOT_COMPILED);
298
299 int capture_count = regexp->capture_count();
300 int output_register_count = JSRegExp::RegistersForCaptureCount(capture_count);
301
302 int32_t* output_registers;
303 std::unique_ptr<int32_t[]> output_registers_release;
304 if (output_register_count <= Isolate::kJSRegexpStaticOffsetsVectorSize) {
305 output_registers = isolate->jsregexp_static_offsets_vector();
306 } else {
307 output_registers = NewArray<int32_t>(output_register_count);
308 output_registers_release.reset(output_registers);
309 }
310
311 do {
312 int num_matches = OneshotExecRaw(isolate, regexp, subject, output_registers,
313 output_register_count, subject_index);
314
315 if (num_matches > 0) {
316 DCHECK_EQ(num_matches, 1);
317 if (exec_quirks == RegExp::ExecQuirks::kTreatMatchAtEndAsFailure) {
318 if (output_registers[0] >= subject->length()) {
319 return isolate->factory()->null_value();
320 }
321 }
322 return RegExp::SetLastMatchInfo(isolate, last_match_info, subject,
323 capture_count, output_registers);
324 } else if (num_matches == 0) {
325 return isolate->factory()->null_value();
326 } else {
327 DCHECK_LT(num_matches, 0);
328 if (num_matches == RegExp::kInternalRegExpRetry) {
329 // Re-run execution.
330 continue;
331 }
332 DCHECK(isolate->has_exception());
333 return MaybeHandle<Object>();
334 }
335 } while (true);
336 UNREACHABLE();
337}
